node.title: Charging the parents after a US school shooting is unusual, but it has happened before
node.description: Guns used in United StatesÂ school shootings have often come from the homes of young perpetrators but parents are rarely charged for the violence that occurs, experts say.
node.content:
["Guns used in United States\u00a0school shootings have often come from the homes of young perpetrators but parents are rarely charged for the violence that occurs, experts say.", "That is what makes the case against Ethan Crumbley's parents uncommon, following the fatal shooting of four students at Oxford High School in Michigan allegedly by their 15-year-old son.", "Oakland County prosecutor Karen McDonald said Jennifer and James Crumbley ignored opportunities to intervene\u00a0with Ethan, as late as just a few hours before the bloodshed their son is accused of perpetrating.", "They are charged with four counts of involuntary manslaughter, while Ethan, 15, is charged as an adult with murder, terrorism and other crimes.", "The Crumbley parents were taken into custody early on Saturday and later appeared in court where they entered not-guilty pleas. Their attorneys said they would fight the charges.", "Here is a look at the issues facing the parents and the unfamiliar legal territory prosecutors will explore.", "
What do we know about the gun?
", "The semi-automatic handgun used in the shooting on Tuesday was purchased by James Crumbley on November 26, while his son stood by at the shop, according to investigators.", "Ethan posted photos of the firearm on social media, saying, \"Just got my new beauty today\", Ms McDonald said.", "The prosecution also claimed that over the Thanksgiving weekend (November 27-28), Jennifer Crumbley wrote on social media that it was a \"Mom and son day testing out his new Christmas present\".", "With some very limited exceptions, minors in Michigan are not allowed to possess guns.", "But no Michigan law requires owners to keep guns locked away from minors.", "\"So many states do. There's 23 states plus Washington DC, that have some form of a secure storage law,\" Michigan Attorney-General Dana Nessel said.", "During the parents' court appearance on\u00a0Saturday, attorney Shannon Smith said the gun used was locked, but she did not say how Ethan got it.", "
Will involuntary manslaughter be hard to prove?
", "", "
James and Jennifer Crumbley pleaded not guilty to manslaughter charges.(AP: Oakland County Sheriff's Office)
", "Police said Ethan Crumbley emerged from a bathroom and started shooting other students in the hallway at Oxford High School.", "A few hours earlier, he and his parents had met with school officials.", "The prosecutor said that meeting was called after a\u00a0teacher\u00a0found a drawing on his desk with a gun pointing at the words:\u00a0\"The thoughts won't stop. Help me.\"", "While Ethan\u00a0had no disciplinary record, his parents were\u00a0told to get him mental health counselling within 48 hours\u00a0but he was allowed to stay in school.", "His backpack was not checked for a weapon, Ms McDonald said.", "", "
Ethan Crumbley (centre)\u00a0is\u00a0charged as an adult with murder, terrorism and other crimes(AP:\u00a0Paul Sancya)
", "Eve Brensike Primus \u2014\u00a0who teaches criminal procedure at the University of Michigan \u2014\u00a0said authorities must show gross negligence by the parents and causation, or the act of causing something.", "\"It's an unusual charge to bring,\" she told The Associated Press.", "\"The prosecutor is going to need facts to support the argument that these parents really knew there was a risk that their son would take a gun and shoot people dead.", "\"Not just that their son was troubled in some way. This is a homicide charge that carries years in prison. This is not a small charge.\"", "
Charging parents is uncommon, but not unprecedented
", "A 2019 assessment by the US Department of Homeland Security found that 76 per cent of school attacks that involved a firearm used guns from the home of a parent or close relative.", "In about half of these cases, the firearms were easily accessible.", "However, laws aimed at restricting gun access are not always enforced and vary in strength, according to some experts.", "\"Our laws haven't really adapted to the reality of school shootings, and the closest we have are these child access prevention laws,\" Kris Brown, president of the Brady gun control advocacy group, said.", "Charging the parents with involuntary manslaughter is not unheard of in the state of Michigan.", "In 2000, a Flint-area man pleaded no contest to involuntary manslaughter after a 6-year-old boy who was living with him found a gun in a shoebox and killed a classmate.", "There have also been similar charges in other parts of the US.", "In 2020, the mother of an Indiana teen was placed on probation for failing to remove guns from her home after her mentally ill son threatened to kill students.", "He fired shots inside his school in 2018. No one was injured but the boy killed himself.", "In Washington state, the father of a boy who killed four students at a high school in 2014 was convicted of illegally possessing firearms. He was not charged for the shooting, although one of his guns was used.", "AP/ABC"]
